com.hush.pgp
Class Keyring

java.lang.Object
  com.hush.pgp.Keyring
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Keyring
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

An object representing a PGP key ring, with the implementation to either read or write it's contents from or to a stream.

See Also:

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream in)
          throws DataFormatException,
                 java.io.IOException
Reads in a key ring from a stream. Bad or unknown packets will be skipped.

It should be possible to call this several times to incrementally load keys.

Parameters:
in - the stream from which to read the key ring
Throws:
DataFormatException
java.io.IOException

save

public void save(java.io.OutputStream out,
                 boolean armor,
                 boolean secret)
Saves in a key ring to a stream.

Parameters:
out - the stream to which to write the key ring
armor - set to true to ASCII armor the output
secret - export secret parts, and only keys that have secret parts

getKeys

public Key[] getKeys(java.lang.String userID)
              throws InvalidSignatureException,
                     MissingSelfSignatureException
Returns all the keys which possess the specified user ID.

Parameters:
userID - the user ID to search for.
Returns:
an array of secret keys.
Throws:
InvalidSignatureException
MissingSelfSignatureException

getKey

public Key getKey(byte[] keyID)
           throws InvalidSignatureException,
                  MissingSelfSignatureException
Returns the key for the specified keyID.

Parameters:
keyID - the key ID of the key to retrieve.
Returns:
an array of secret keys.
Throws:
InvalidSignatureException - if a signature on a key failed
MissingSelfSignature - if a key is missing a self signature
MissingSelfSignatureException

getAllEncryptionKeys

public Key[] getAllEncryptionKeys()
                           throws InvalidSignatureException,
                                  MissingSelfSignatureException
Returns every encryption key (or subkey) in the keyring as a flat array. Useful for trying to decrypt wildcard messages that could be encrypted with any key.

Throws:
InvalidSignatureException
MissingSelfSignatureException

addKey

public Key addKey(Key key)
Adds the key to the keyring. If a key with the Key ID already exists, merge it into the original and return a reference to the original.

Parameters:
key - the key to add
Returns:
a reference to the added (or merged) key

getVerifySelfSignatures

public boolean getVerifySelfSignatures()
Returns whether this class is set to verify self-signatures on key retrieval.

Returns:
true if self-signatures will be verified; false if not.

setVerifySelfSignatures

public void setVerifySelfSignatures(boolean verifySelfSignatures)
Sets the whether self-signatures are verified on key retrieval. Don't set this to false unless you know what you are doing.

Parameters:
verifySelfSignatures - whether or not to verify self-signatures.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Gets the entire key ring as an ASCII armored string. Exports only public components of keys.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

toString

public java.lang.String toString(boolean secret)
Gets the entire key ring as an ASCII armored string.

Parameters:
secret - export the secret parts, and only keys that have secret parts
